newsitem.title: UK: Tesco 500 mln stg bid for Irish stores fail.
newsitem.headline: Tesco 500 mln stg bid for Irish stores fail.

text.p: British food retailer Tesco has failed in talks with Associated British Foods to press a bid for three Irish supermarket chains owned by the food manufacturer, the Financial Times said on Thursday.
The paper said Tesco's 500 million pound ($797.3 million) bid for the Quinnsworth, Stewarts and Crazy Prices chains failed on Wednesday.
The resumption of talks was possible but unlikely, it added.

The deal would have given Tesco a 27 percent market share of the annual 4.24 billion pounds food market in the Republic of Ireland and 39 percent of the Northern Ireland market worth 1.9 billion pounds.
The paper did not give any reasons for the failure of the talks.
